Posts.Content: I thought this was temporary but was told they would not come back, you get used to it so don't worry x
Posts.Title: Damaged veins

Posts.Content: Once it started to come back I kept it short for a few months almost to keep it strong if that sounds strange, but then returned to my original style. It grows pretty quickly although it came back sooooo grey. My eyelashes came back but quite sparse so I got them tattooed, I wish I had done that years ago.
Posts.Title: Does anyone have curly chemo hair ?

Posts.Content: From the earlier comment I meant my eyebrows!!
Posts.Title: Does anyone have curly chemo hair ?

Posts.Content: My hair grew back similar to a Brillo pad but then went back to nearly how it was before, it was slightly thinner and I have to be careful with using too much heat on it but you really could not tell the difference.
Posts.Title: Does anyone have curly chemo hair ?

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with breast cancer March 2013, had a mastectomy and then chemo. I was advised to ask for help financially as I worked two jobs to pay my mortgage and support my children. The only help I got was that my mortgage company would reduce my payments whilst I was unable to do both my jobs. Now a year later this is ending my mortgage payments have risen by over £200 a month I am still unable to work my original 70 hours a week but yet I am still getting punished. Why is there no help for hard working people who try and pay their bills an mortgage each month. In my 48 years I have never claimed ANYTHING from the government, I am disgusted and ashamed with the government. Everyone says you can get help and all these organisations will assist you, THEY WILL NOT. I am sorry but I had to put this in writing as I am have been so let down!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Posts.Title: No financial help!!
